It can be particularly damaging if the speaker has more power than the person they're addressing, as this can create an environment of fear and undermine their trust in you. Where possible, try to offer constructive criticism instead, asthis approach allows people to learn from their mistakes while still preserving your opinion.
 
It's also important not to speak negatively about others in front of other people; doing so can demote them and make them feel like they don't have the capability to do certain tasks. Instead, focus on things that could be improved and give advice in a polite and considerate way. This will show that you respect their skills and abilities, even if you think they could be enhanced upon. 
 
Finally, when speaking about someone else in a negative light, be aware of how it may affect them. If you find yourself talking down another person, stop yourself mid-sentence and contemplate how what you're saying could potentially ruin their life or damage their confidence. Being mindful of how our words can impact others is essential for building strong relationships and having a positive influence.
